request_pathways.name: Authorization to Send Health Information (2024 fillable)
Medical Records fax (number on form header)

access_pathway.primary_pathway_description: Patient uses a generic ROI authorization form with a 'Patient copy' checkbox to request their own records.

red_flags: No submission instructions — patient has no guidance on where to send completed form
Verbal communication line copied from companion form creates confusion about what this form authorizes
bright_spots: 'Patient copy' as explicit reason-for-release checkbox normalizes patient self-access
One-page design efficiently covers three record categories with date ranges
36 fillable interactive fields enable complete digital form-filling

findability.rationale: Rubric level 3: requires moderate effort — the org's own forms page doesn't render (JavaScript-dependent), forcing reliance on a site-scoped search engine query to locate the PDF in a WordPress uploads directory.

technical_accessibility.rationale: Rubric level 4: mostly digital with one gap — the form has 36 fillable fields for on-screen completion, but submission requires faxing to a number listed on the form header (no online submission portal).

content_design.rationale: Rubric level 4: well-organized with minor clarity issues — the one-page layout is logical with clear section headers, but sender/recipient fields confuse patient self-access use and a verbal communication line was erroneously copied from the companion form.

patient_centeredness.rationale: Rubric level 3: a patient can use the process but it wasn't designed for them — the form is a generic third-party release authorization that accommodates patient access only via a 'Patient copy' checkbox, with no dedicated pathway or patient rights language.

compliance.rationale: Rubric level 4: minor ambiguities but nothing materially impeding — no notarization required, photocopy/facsimile accepted, revocation section included, but no fee disclosure, incomplete HIPAA citation, and conditioning-of-treatment language uses imprecise 'might' phrasing.

overall.summary: CHCB provides a technically competent fillable PDF authorization form that accommodates patient self-access via a 'Patient copy' checkbox, but the generic third-party release framing, absent submission instructions, and lack of dedicated patient access pathway limit the overall patient experience.
